intro: Hieracium cirritum subsp. rhenifontis, commonly known as the Rhenish hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange-colored composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and the stems are often reddish in color. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
